p: Permethrin was highly toxic for M. domestica (LD 50 = 0.023 µg/fly), followed by C. megacephala (0.050 µg/fly), L. cuprina (0.059 µg/fly) and C. rufifacies (0.060 µg/fly). In contrast, deltamethrin was highly toxic for L. cuprina (LD 50 = 0.009 µg/fly), followed by C. megacephala (0.028 µg/fly), C. rufifacies (0.028 µg/fly) and M. domestica (0.060 µg/fly) ( Table 6). No mortality was observed in the control flies.
